subject: Marketing
title: Cultural Relativism in Marketing
description: A quick, practical guide to Cultural Relativism in Marketing.

hook.text: An ad considered empowering in New York was deemed offensive in Tokyo. Same message, different values.

buildup.text: Cultural relativism argues that ethics depend on cultural context, not universal rules.

discovery.text: Global brands face impossible choices when cultural norms conflict across markets.

twist.text: Using cultural relativism as an excuse can justify genuinely harmful practices abroad.

climax.text: The challenge is respecting cultural differences without abandoning core ethical principles.

punchline.text: Respect culture. But never abandon principles.

quiz.question: What challenge does cultural relativism create for global marketing?
options: Cultural norms conflict, making universal ethics difficult
All cultures share identical marketing values
Only Western markets have marketing ethics standards
